title: Frida, Frida-tools, Android version Problems
content:
I have this environment..

  • android : 9 version
  • python : 2.7.12

I am not sure which version of Frida and Frida-tools I need to use to be compatible. I'm currently using 12.8.5, but an ascii codec error keeps occurring, possibly due to incompatibility. If you know a way to solve this or a suitable compatible version, please let me know.

please. thank you ;-0 ps. I have no intention of upgrading a Python version.

comments.text: Make sure to use the same frida version on the PC side as well as on Android (frida-server). Anyway Python 3 can be installed in parallel to Python 2 so there is no "upgrade" necessary. You could keep your python 2 environment for whatever you need it and use latest frida on Python 3.
Thanks you. I found compatible Frida and Frida-tools version.

answers_data.content:
I'll recommend the latest versions of frida & frida tools,

But, if you want to work with frida 12.8.5 only, then I'll suggest using frida-tools version 6.0.0

To install:- pip2 install frida-tools==6.0.0

How did I figure this out ? By matching the release date of both frida & frida-tools. Frida 12.8.5 ( Jan 4, 2020 ) https://github.com/frida/frida/tree/12.8.5

Frida-tools 6.0.0 ( Jan 4 2020 ) https://pypi.org/project/frida-tools/6.0.0/
